ygData.subject: Evolving constant outputs
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, I m using NEAT in a system where there are three outputs, but only one output is required to change over time according to the network inputs, and the

Subject: Evolving constant outputs
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=405026570; y=htpE48xdvmCuRhRMUDDNnyR1jiDjKt-ivjTocyAuhz2SfFZTXSA
X-Yahoo-Profile: dizzyphoton

Hi all,

I'm using NEAT in a system where there are three outputs, but only=
 one output is required to change over time according to the network inputs=
, and the two are to remain constant, defining some constant values in my s=
ystem.

The way i've implemented this is to, on the first timestep of a sim=
ulation, set all network inputs to one, read the designated constant output=
 nodes from the network, then from then on, ignore the constant output node=
s, apply normal inputs and read the changing output node.

The problem howe=
ver, is that there doesn't seem to be much exploration on the constant outp=
ut nodes at all. Most times after evolution the value of most constant outp=
ut nodes is 0.5, the default value indicating no connection was made to tha=
t output node.

My question is, are there any parameters I should be playin=
g with to increase exploration on these constant outputs, or is there a bet=
ter way to evolve constant outputs together with changing outputs?

Playing=
 with the starting connection proportion and add connection mutation rate s=
eem to help, but not much.

Thanks for any help!
